Hi Wei-1,

Overall nice problematic.

My skills in Maths, stats, and proba are a bit rusty but here are advice on popularization and a few questions regarding the process.

1) A separator is not a Pupa, a Separator is between two consecutive Pupae.
2) I think you can popularize ( - Weighted Entropy) as Score and ( - Entropy) as Group Consistency. 
"
We look for the BEST separator between two groups A and B as the separator with the Highest Score.
Its score is determined by the probability of a beetle to end up in group A (Pa) multiplied by the group A Consistency (Ca) + Pb * Cb
Considering the Probability of a pupa to belong to a Specie (Ps)
A group Consistency is the sum, for each of the species in contains, of the probability of a pupa to belong to this species (Ps) multiplied by log2(Ps)
"

By the way, this second formula is not the Binary entropy function.  It is the Entropy function based on the Probability mass function.

I assume you compute Pa as follow:
for Na being the number of beetles in group A and N being the total number of beetles:
Pa = Na / N

However I don't get how you compute the probability of a beetle to belong to the Specie S (PS).
I would naturally go for Ps = Number of beetles belonging to S / N
But it clearly set the horn length as useless. I think something is missing for me to be able to understand the method. (and I come from a scientific background...)

I think if you want a 10Yo to get it you need to lay each step you use to resolve this (here Probability computation missing for me) and describe the step without any technical world.

I tried my best to replace entropies but I am missing the understanding of the next step to be able to popularize it.
Good luck !

- The binary tree is created by a series of binary separators : what is a binary separator ? 
- The equation how we choose the pupa to be the separator is binary entropy. And we find the best separator in the group with its corresponding weighted entropy. Explain binary & weighted entropy

The horn length of a beetle is what we use to be the separator.
So the beetle is the separator.
Your assumption of how "the probability of a species in a group" is correct.
The thing that is missing is how we use horn length to separate a group into 2 groups.

If you are talking about test case 1,
it is because we need to select a pupa which has a horn length that the other pupa with a smaller horn length will be separate into a sub-group.
Since the sub-group only has 1 pupa and has only 1 species, the entropy is 0.
I think the idea is that I give a step by step example in the statement.
I will add this right now.

For test 4 and validator 4, the difference is that there are several pupae with the same horn length!
So in test4, when you choice pupa-2 as the separator, you won't be able to separate pupa-0,1 into a group.
Instead, you will get the same result as using pupa-1 since they have the same horn length.
